alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:23PM CDT until July 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. 1.88 inches of rain have already fallen at Buffalo Bayou at Milam. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Houston, Fourth Ward, Midtown Houston, Greater Third Ward, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Eastwood, Second Ward, Near Northside Houston, Greater Fifth Ward, Macgregor, southeastern Greater Heights, eastern Memorial Park, University Place, Museum Park, Herman Park, Medical Center Area, Kashmere Gardens, Discovery Green, Minute Maid Park and Compass Stadium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
